revised_title: An Analysis of the Chemical Composition of Castle-Loed and Fairburn Sulphureous Mineral Waters
tldr: The author examines the chemical composition of the sulphureous mineral waters of Castle-Loed and Fairburn, as well as the salt-purging water of Pitkeathly. The Castle-Loed water contains a strong sulphuric component, which is found to be both absorbent and insoluble. The water is found to have various medicinal properties, such as clearing foul faces and aiding in the treatment of skin disorders.
